lesson_html:
• Hello! - A common way to greet someone.
  • Good morning! - Used in the morning until around noon.
  • Good afternoon! - Used from noon until about 6 PM.
  • Good evening! - Used after 6 PM.
  • How are you? - A friendly way to ask about someone's well-being.

items.explanation_en: A formal way to ask someone how they are.
A common question to start a conversation.
A friendly expression of concern for someone's well-being.
A way to ask someone about their current experience.
A question to understand someone's purpose for being present.

items.en: Did you have a good night?
items.explanation_en: A way to ask about someone's previous evening.
A question to check if someone is prepared.

items.en: What are your plans for today?
items.explanation_en: A way to inquire about someone's schedule.

items.en: It was nice talking to you.
items.explanation_en: A polite way to conclude a conversation.

items.en: Take care and see you soon!
items.explanation_en: A friendly farewell wishing someone well.
